etymology.description: Metal radical 釒(釒) (jīn, 'metal') -> simplified to 钅(钅) (jīn, 'metal') for use in compound characters
etymology.interpretation: The character 钅(钅) is the simplified form of the metal radical 釒(釒), which represents 'metal.' The simplification retains the essential elements in a more concise form and is often used in compound characters involving metal.
etymology.simplification: 釒(釒) (jīn, 'metal') simplified by reducing strokes and creating 钅(钅) to streamline its use in characters.

examples.chinese: 科学家研究钅的物理特性(科學家研究钅的物理特性)。
examples.pinyin: Kēxuéjiā yánjiū jīn de wùlǐ tèxìng.
examples.english: Scientists study the physical properties of metal.

examples.chinese: 古代文明崇尚钅的力量(古代文明崇尚钅的力量)，铸造出不朽器物(鑄造出不朽器物)。
examples.pinyin: Gǔdài wénmíng chóngshàng jīn de lìliàng, zhùzào chū bùxiǔ qìwù.
examples.english: Ancient civilizations revered the power of metal and forged timeless artifacts.

examples.chinese: 艺术家用钅打造现代雕塑(藝術家用钅打造現代雕塑)。
examples.pinyin: Yìshùjiā yòng jīn dǎzào xiàndài diāosù.
examples.english: Artists use metal to create modern sculptures.
